title: After Muslim MLAs remark, Suvendu raises pitch against TMC over Ram Navami
content: West Bengal BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari criticizes the Trinamool government, claiming that Hindus will resist any attempt to stop Ram Navami celebrations and accusing Mamata Banerjee of appeasing a particular community. This comes amid heightened tensions and allegations of violence during Holi in the state.

title: 'Vacate PoK': MEA slams Pak for calling PM Modi's remark 'misleading'
content: India has responded strongly to Pakistan's comments on PM Modi's remarks about Jammu & Kashmir, labeling Islamabad as a sponsor of cross-border terrorism that hinders regional peace. The Kashmir issue remains unresolved since 1947, with Pakistan occupying parts of Kashmir and backing terrorism. India's position on Kashmir was reaffirmed with the revocation of Article 370 in 2019.

title: Elon Musk names Jeff Bezos & Google, Oracle founders as smartest people he knows
content: Elon Musk praised several tech leaders including Larry Ellison, Larry Page, and Jeff Bezos for their intelligence and achievements. Despite Musk and Bezos' past rivalry, their relationship appears to be improving, notably highlighted by Musk's recent memes suggesting reconciliation.

title: Investors wealthier by Rs 8.67 L cr in 2 days - Why markets are rising
content: BSE Sensex and Nifty50 indices saw significant rallies, with Sensex rising by 1,131 points and Nifty50 by 326 points on Tuesday. Key factors driving the rally were global market cues, China's economic stimulus, and positive technical indicators.

title: Ukraine war or Indo-Pacific, India & EU must stick together: Sweden minister
content: Sweden's Foreign Minister Maria Malmer Stenergard emphasized the importance of democracies upholding a rules-based order, particularly in the Indo-Pacific where China poses challenges. Sweden supports India's Make in India initiative, contributing through defence cooperation. She backed Nato and discussed potential India-EU FTA benefits, highlighting India's vital role in maintaining global peace and security.

title: IPL 2025: Punjab Kings Team Preview - SWOT Analysis and Best XI
content: Punjab Kings have appointed Shreyas Iyer as their captain for IPL 2025 and revamped their squad. They have retained only two players and introduced several new faces. With a mix of explosive batting and strong bowling, they aim to finally secure their first IPL title. Their balance of power and strategy looks promising for the upcoming season.

title: JP Morgan CEO to Stanford University students: I don’t defend your right to...
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon has mandated five days of office work starting this month, asserting it is the best way to run the company. Dimon highlighted the importance of in-person work for learning, innovation, and company culture, emphasizing its criticality for younger employees and managerial communication.

title: US, France squabble over Statue of Liberty
content: The Trump White House received backlash for suggesting France should be grateful for U.S. help in WWII after a French politician suggested the U.S. return the Statue of Liberty. Responses highlighted France's crucial role in America's independence, the German defeat by Russia, and French support for American freedom over Indian aid against the British.

title: Google-parent Alphabet buys Israeli startup Wiz for $32 billion in CASH
content: Alphabet plans to acquire cybersecurity startup Wiz for $32 billion, enhancing its cloud offerings. The acquisition, awaiting regulatory approval, marks Alphabet's largest to date and aims to bolster its competitiveness against AWS and Microsoft Azure while improving cybersecurity capabilities using AI-driven solutions.

title: Two Dalai Lamas? How China's plan could spark a global crisis
content: The Dalai Lama has declared that his successor will be born outside of China to ensure freedom from Chinese control, escalating the ongoing succession dispute. China's government maintains it has the right to appoint the next Dalai Lama, aiming to preserve political dominance over Tibet.

title: Rajnath asks Netherlands not to supply weapons to terror-sponsor Pakistan
content: India has asked the Netherlands to halt supplying arms and military technology to Pakistan due to its history of sponsoring terrorism. In a meeting between defence ministers, both countries agreed to strengthen ties in defence, security, maritime cooperation, and emerging technologies. Collaboration in shipbuilding and space sectors was also discussed, alongside integrating Indian vendors into Dutch supply chains.

title: KL Rahul puts team first yet again, will bat in the middle-order for DC
content: KL Rahul continues to exhibit flexibility in his batting roles, transitioning between top-order, middle-order, and finisher positions across formats. His adaptability will be tested once more as he  likely bats in the middle-order for Delhi Capitals in the upcoming Indian Premier League season. While he last played a T20I back in the 2022 T20 World Cup, movement in the batting order could well continue when he turns up for Delhi Capitals - his fifth Indian Premier League franchise.

title: How Trump's White House Secretary trolled a French politician
content: Leavitt’s journey to the White House podium started in the small town of Atkinson, New Hampshire, where she grew up in a conservative, business-oriented household. Her parents ran an ice cream shop and a used truck dealership—a background that might explain her relentless work ethic and ability to sell a message with conviction.

title: Arson, stone-pelting, attack on cops: How Nagpur endured a night full of chaos
content: Violent clashes erupted in central Nagpur near the RSS headquarters after protests over the removal of Aurangzeb's tomb escalated. Police and firemen were injured, vehicles torched, and widespread property damage ensued. Union home ministry demanded a report, while Chief Minister and local officials appealed for calm and assured strict action against rioters.

title: Bill Gates names three key supporters of Satya Nadella as Microsoft CEO
content: Bill Gates discussed the pivotal decision to appoint Satya Nadella as CEO with the support of key figures, including himself, Steve Ballmer, and Brad Smith. Gates expressed confidence in the choice, reflecting on Microsoft's continued excellence and successful leadership transition.

title: Vadodara car crash: 'Rakshit Chaurasiya may have insisted on driving'
content: CCTV footage from the investigation into a fatal accident revealed that Pranshu Chauhan initially took the driver's seat but then moved to the front passenger seat at the insistence of Rakshit Chaurasiya. Chaurasiya then drove the car and later crashed into three two-wheelers, killing one woman and injuring seven others.

title: 'You need family, but ...': Kapil Dev on BCCI's family travel curbs during tours
content: Kapil Dev emphasises a balanced approach for cricketers’ families during extended tours, aligning with BCCI's new policy. Families can join players for limited days depending on tour length. Virat Kohli also highlights the importance of family support for player rejuvenation. Kapil expressed this at an event featuring top golfers in New Delhi.

title: India, France to kick off high-voltage naval exercise in Arabian Sea
content: India and France kick off the ‘Varuna’ naval exercise in the Arabian Sea, involving aircraft carriers, warships, submarines, fighters, and helicopters. INS Vikrant and the French aircraft carrier Charles De Gaulle are among the highlighted participants. The exercise includes maritime drills and tactical operations, enhancing naval interoperability and operational synergy between the two nations.

title: IPL: Lucknow Super Giants Team Preview - SWOT Analysis and Best XI
content: Lucknow Super Giants revamped their squad for IPL 2025, parting with KL Rahul and appointing Rishabh Pant as captain. They bolstered their lineup with stars like David Miller, Aiden Markram and Mitchell Marsh. Their powerful batting unit looks strong, but their pace attack's fitness remains a concern. LSG aim to bounce back and contend for the title.

title: UP court gives death penalty to 3 men for killing 24 Dalits in 1981
content: A Uttar Pradesh court has sentenced three men to death for the 1981 massacre of 24 Dalits in Dehuli. The massacre was allegedly to punish Dalit witnesses against upper-caste criminals. Of the 17 accused, 14 died during the trial, while another is absconding. The remaining three, all in their early 70s, were convicted on Tuesday.

title: How PM Modi's 'Mann Ki Baat' changed this German girl's life forever
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's mention of German singer Cassandra Mae Spittmann in Mann Ki Baat changed her life. He praised her dedication to Indian culture. She expressed profound gratitude and admiration for Modi. Her renditions in multiple Indian languages received high praise. This recognition was life-changing for her.

title: Don't think Kohli necessarily turned down RCB's captaincy: De Villiers
content: Former RCB batter AB de Villiers shared that Virat Kohli supported the decision to appoint Rajat Patidar as the new RCB captain. Kohli's mature reaction and endorsement of the decision highlight his commitment to the team's future. RCB's leadership, including head coach Andy Flower, praised Kohli's respect and support for Patidar as crucial for the team's success.

title: JFK Files: Will we finally learn truth about Marilyn Monroe or Cuba?
content: To understand the importance of the JFK files, we need to go back to the man himself. John F. Kennedy was more than just a president—he was a symbol, a paradox, and in many ways, a myth. He was a war hero, yet his family’s wealth and influence had insulated him from the struggles of ordinary Americans. He was a devout Catholic, yet his personal life was a whirlwind of extramarital affairs, including a rumored relationship with Marilyn Monroe. He was a Cold War warrior, taking America to the brink of nuclear war during the Cuban Missile Crisis, yet he spoke of peace and sought diplomacy with the Soviet Union. For many Americans, Kennedy was the embodiment of youthful optimism, of a nation on the cusp of greatness. But behind the glamour of Camelot, there were shadows—secrets within his administration, tensions with intelligence agencies, and enemies both at home and abroad.

title: Elon Musk's ex & mother of his three children on hardest part of parenting
content: Grimes, Elon Musk's ex-girlfriend and mother of his three children, frequently shares parenting struggles on Twitter. She recently spoke about the challenges of putting kids to bed. Additionally, Grimes has denied writing about the "sexuality and kinks" of Fortune 500 CEOs.

title: Tracy Morgan vomits courtside during Heat vs Knicks game: What happened?
content: Comedian Tracy Morgan experienced a medical emergency during the Knicks vs. Heat game at Madison Square Garden, where he was seen vomiting and left in a wheelchair. Fans and celebrities expressed concern and support, yet there is no update on his condition. Morgan has a history of health issues including past kidney transplant and car accident.

title: Parents of missing Indian-origin student ask officials to declare daughter dead
content: Sudiksha Konanki's parents wrote they have full trust in the investigation process and they believe Joshua Riibe, the 24-year-old with whom Konanki was last seen, has been cooperating with the investigators. They told the administration that once Sudiksha is legally declared dead, the family can initiate the process of grieving and honoring her memory.

title: Team of 6 Supreme Court judges to visit Manipur relief camps on March 22
content: A team of six Supreme Court judges, headed by Justice BR Gavai, will visit violence-affected relief camps in Manipur on March 22. The delegation aims to assess the situation and improve legal and humanitarian support for those affected. The Supreme Court has been monitoring the crisis and the visit underscores efforts to address on-ground concerns.

title: Nagpur violence: 'Chhaava' film reignited people's emotions,' says Fadnavis
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis attributed recent violence in Nagpur to heightened emotions from the Chhaava movie, which depicts Maratha history. Violence erupted after protests against Aurangzeb's tomb, leading to curfew and multiple injuries. Authorities are investigating the premeditated attacks and ensure the responsible parties face consequences. Deputy CM Eknath Shinde also highlighted concerns about targeted conspiracies.

title: Trump deploys Indian-origin lawyer to defend deportation
content: The Trump administration, led by Indian-origin lawyer Abhishek Kambli, is defying a federal judge's orders to halt deportation flights of illegal immigrants. MAGA activists criticize the judge, claiming bias due to his daughter's work. Kambli argues the orders were issued after the flights had departed, and refuses to disclose details citing national security.

title: NPCI is making a big change to UPI feature widely misused in scams
content: The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) is phasing out the 'Collect Payments' feature from the UPI platform to curb fraud. This method will now be limited to verified merchants, with person-to-person requests capped at Rs 2,000, while promoting QR code-based payments.

title: Virat Kohli gets roaring welcome, surprises fans with special gift – WATCH
content: RCB launched their IPL 2025 campaign with an RCB Unbox Event, featuring Virat Kohli and new skipper Rajat Patidar. The event included the unveiling of the new team jersey, performances, and fan interactions. RCB aims to start strong against Kolkata Knight Riders on March 22.  The event featured the grand unveiling of the team’s new jersey, along with live performances and engaging interactions with players, including Virat and the newly appointed skipper, Rajat Patidar.

title: “...so very very silly,” says engineer after Meta fired him for sharing Zuckerberg's post
content: Riley Berton, a former Meta engineer, claims he was fired for sharing already-public information with his wife, questioning the company's privacy policies. He alleges 'hundreds' of colleagues faced similar terminations amid Meta's crackdown on leaks, raising concerns about workplace privacy and personal communication boundaries.

title: Watch: Raid on call centre in Pak takes bizarre turn as locals loot laptops
content: Chaos erupted in Islamabad's Sector F-11 after a raid by Pakistan's Federal Investigation Agency on a fake call center run by Chinese nationals led to looting. Despite the detention of over two dozen individuals, locals looted the premises, seizing valuables such as electronic equipment.

title: 'Sleep at 10, improve diet': Shashank on how to revive Prithvi Shaw's career
content: Once a promising talent, Prithvi Shaw's career has hit a rough patch, with setbacks like not being sold in the IPL 2025 auction and being left out of Mumbai's squads. Punjab Kings' Shashank Singh believes Shaw's potential is intact and suggests lifestyle changes, like better sleep and diet, could revive his career, emphasising discipline as key.

title: Ready to deliberate upon uploading booth-wise votes: Poll body to SC
content: The Election Commission of India (ECI) expressed willingness to consider the demand for publishing booth-wise voter turnout data online during a Supreme Court hearing. The petitioners, TMC MP Mahua Moitra and Association for Democratic Reforms, have 10 days to make representations before the ECI. The ECI aims to address discrepancies in voter turnout data, ensuring transparency.

title: BJP wants to make Maharashtra next Manipur, says Aaditya Thackeray
content: Shiv Sena UBT leader Aaditya Thackeray criticized the Devendra Fadnavis-led BJP government for its handling of the Nagpur violence, suggesting it aimed to destabilize Maharashtra similar to Manipur. Thackeray highlighted the lack of response from the Chief Minister’s Office. Fadnavis addressed the legislative assembly, asserting the violence appeared well-planned and emphasized strict action against those responsible.

title: How Indian-origin NASA astronaut Sunita Williams united America and Russia
content: NASA astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore are finally returning to Earth after nine months on the ISS due to propulsion issues with their Boeing Starliner. NASA's Crew-10 astronauts have replaced Crew-9, with members including Anne McClain, Nichole Ayers, Takuya Onishi, and Kirill Peskov, representing multiple nationalities.

title: LeBron James' son Bronny James’ Garbage Time Bucket
content: Bronny James scored a 3-pointer for the LA Lakers during garbage time in a win against the San Antonio Spurs. This moment delighted former NBA player Gilbert Arenas, who has been a vocal supporter of Bronny and believes in his potential as a valuable player.

title: IPL 2025: LSG stare at pace crisis with multiple injuries
content: Lucknow Super Giants are facing concerns over the fitness of their key fast bowlers ahead of the 2025 IPL season opener. With Mohsin Khan, Mayank Yadav, and Akash Deep dealing with injuries, the team considers turning to backup options Shardul Thakur and Shivam Mavi. Will the management take the big risk of persisting with undercooked and injury prone seamers or hand contracts to Thakur and Mavi? The big call is expected very soon!

title: Hamas claims head of its government in Gaza killed in Israeli strikes
content: Hamas claimed its Gaza government head Essam al-Dalis was killed in Israeli strikes that also killed over 300 people. Israel cited Hamas's refusal to release hostages as the reason for the attacks. The recent failed truce talks led to renewed violence, with deep-rooted mutual distrust and unresolved strategic differences between Israel and Hamas exacerbating the conflict.

title: Steelers' Heyward fed up waiting on Rodgers
content: Steelers defensive tackle Cameron Heyward said on his podcast Tuesday that he has no plans to recruit Aaron Rodgers and that he just wants Pittsburgh's quarterback situation settled.

title: Broome, Flagg unanimous All-American selections
content: Johni Broome of Auburn and Cooper Flagg of Duke were unanimous first-team picks for The Associated Press men's college basketball All-America teams released Tuesday.

title: Tracy Morgan: Food poisoning caused MSG illness
content: Tracy Morgan says food poisoning was to blame for his taking ill during Monday's Knicks-Heat game, and that he's "doing OK."

title: Eagles' Graham officially retires after 15 seasons
content: Eagles star and fan favorite Brandon Graham officially announced his retirement Tuesday after 15 seasons in the NFL.

title: Ohtani 'nervous' in Tokyo but gets 2 hits, runs
content: Shohei Ohtani said it had been "a while since I felt this nervous playing a game," but managed two hits and two runs Tuesday as the Dodgers won their Opening Day game in Tokyo.

title: Players file suits vs. ATP, WTA: 'Tennis is broken'
content: Multiple lawsuits were filed Tuesday by the PTPA and 22 players against the ATP, WTA, ITF and ITIA, alleging anticompetitive business practices, monopolizing of professional tennis and systemic abuse.

title: Westbrook 'a wolf,' fuels Nuggets' improbable win
content: Russell Westbrook set the tone for an undermanned Nuggets team Monday night at Golden State, prompting teammate Aaron Gordon to remark, "First off, Russ is not just a dog. He's a wolf."

title: Brink 'icked out' by replies to Sparks' male tryouts
content: Sparks forward Cameron Brink said she was unsettled by the response she saw online to a call by the team for men to try out for the practice squad.

title: Giant Killers: Predicting 10 women's March Madness early-round upsets
content: Looking for upsets in the women's March Madness bracket? Harvard, Vanderbilt and South Dakota State are looking to hang around.

title: 'It's Pop's decision. He's earned that': Inside Gregg Popovich's fight to return to the sideline
content: For the first time in 30 years, the legendary coach has been on a different sideline, battling to return to what he once was. This is the story of his season -- and what might come next for the proud franchise he leads.

title: 'I didn't know Kyle Tucker spoke': 'Silent assassin' could be MLB's next $400 million star
content: The new Cubs outfielder is still the same slugger he was back when he was breaking records in high school.

title: NFL experts debate free agency: What were the biggest head-scratcher signings?
content: We asked 10 experts to weigh in on the best (Davante Adams?) and worst moves (Javon Kinlaw?) from NFL free agency.

content: Which team on the fringe is getting in? And which is under the most pressure in the final month? Who wins the Hart Trophy?

title: NHL playoff watch: Will the Oilers win the Pacific Division crown?
content: The race against the Golden Knights for the No. 1 seed is not over yet. Plus, full playoff projections, draft lottery standings, more.

title: Predicting the Premier League stretch, from Champions League race to relegation
content: With the just nine matchdays left in the 2024-25 Premier League season, how will things shake out for Arsenal, Man City, Chelsea and others? Let's predict how the final stretch plays out.

title: When can Liverpool win the Premier League title?
content: Liverpool have built up a 12-point lead at the top of the table. How early could the championship be sealed?

title: Crowning a champion in our 64-team college football bracket
content: From the Sweet 16 to the Final Four, we determine who is left standing at the end of our football version of March Madness.

title: You've signed a one-of-a-kind freshman in Cooper Flagg. Now what? Here's how Duke built a contender around its prized recruit
content: In an era when teams are incentivized to build around experience, the Blue Devils built a contender with youth.

title: Men's March Madness storylines: Cooper Flagg's impact and SEC dominance
content: How has the industry reacted to the bracket? There's plenty at stake in one of the year's biggest betting events.

title: MLB's villains or its gold standard? How the Dodgers got here
content: Love them or loathe them, the defending champs built a new evil empire with a series of monumental moves.

title: College softball rankings: The Top 25 teams after Week 6
content: Is Oklahoma still No. 1? Which team dropped out this week? Here's the updated college softball Top 25 poll for Week 6.

title: Takeaways from Indian Wells -- and what they mean for Miami Open
content: Will Djokovic and Swiatek turn their season around? Can Andreeva continue her incredible run? The biggest questions as the Miami Open begins.

title: Pochettino open to Spurs return, not before '26 WC
content: Mauricio Pochettino has said he would be open to returning one day as Tottenham manager, but not before leading the USMNT at the 2026 World Cup.

title: Cavallo reveals daily death threats for being gay
content: Josh Cavallo, men's football's first openly gay active player, said he struggles encourage other players to come out due to the sport's "toxic" environment.

title: Sources: MLS ASG to host best of Liga MX again
content: Major League Soccer will host Liga MX for the 2025 All-Star match on July 23 at Q2 Stadium in Austin, Texas, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: City in double-injury blow ahead of Chelsea QF
content: Manchester City boss Nick Cushing has confirmed that his side will be without Khadija Shaw and Aoba Fujino for their Champions League quarterfinal first-leg against Chelsea.

title: Mateta eyes FA Cup return after ear 'destroyed'
content: Crystal Palace forward Jean-Philippe Mateta has said he is hoping to return to football in next week's FA Cup clash against Fulham.

title: Denver's new NWSL team reveals stadium plan
content: The ownership group for Denver's NWSL expansion team, which begins play in 2026, announced plans to build a 14,500-seat stadium on Tuesday.

title: Courtois hopes Belgium exile drama now over
content: Belgium goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois said he has poken to teammates about his lengthy exile from the national side.

title: Messi out for Argentina after MRI reveals injury
content: Lionel Messi will not join Argentina for World Cup qualifiers against Brazil and Uruguay, failing to make the final roster after featuring in the pre-list.

title: What would it take for Wrexham to reach Premier League from League 1?
content: Wrexham's rise from nonleague has truly been the stuff of Hollywood legend -- no surprise given their owners. But can they now actually get to the Premier League from here?

title: Unretired and unbeaten: Wojciech Szczesny's fairy-tale return to football
content: Szczesny retired just over 200 days ago. Now, he's back with Barcelona and undefeated in 17 appearances.

title: Boxing divisional rankings: Flyweight has a new No. 1
content: Kenoshiro Teraji takes Seigo Yuri Akui's top spot at flyweight after a comeback TKO win. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: WNBA trade grades: Did the defending champion Liberty get even better in trade for Cloud?
content: Natasha Cloud gives New York another skilled distributor and a stronger defense, while Connecticut gains two first-round picks to help its rebuild.

title: Waiver wire pickups: Two Warriors to add now
content: The fantasy basketball waiver wire always has players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add this week.

title: Six March Madness stars to watch
content: Eric Moody breaks down which players fantasy managers should keep an eye on during the 2025 Women's NCAA tournament.

title: Trump-Putin Talks On Ending Russia-Ukraine War Going Well: White House
content: US President Donald Trump today dialled his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin in an attempt to find an end to the war in Ukraine.

title: "Someone Who Lived 300 Years Ago...": Uddhav Thackeray On Aurangzeb Row
content: Amid violence in Maharashtra's Nagpur - over demands Mughal ruler Aurangzeb's grave be moved out of the state - ex-Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray questioned the need for a face-off, pointing out the Mughal emperor had died over 300 years ago.

title: "Thousands Crying": Supreme Court Talks Of CBI Probe Into Homeowners' Troubles
content: The Supreme Court has expressed concern about the alleged nexus between banks and builders and assured that a probe by the Central Bureau of Investigation will be held into the grievances of homeowners.

title: Uddhav Thackeray Bowed Before PM Modi: Eknath Shinde's Big Claim
content: Former Chief Minister of Maharashtra Uddhav Thackeray had bowed down before Prime Minister Narendra Modi, asking to be saved from the action of investigating agencies, Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde has claimed.

title: Return To Fighting In Gaza 'Fully Coordinated With Washington': Israel
content: Israeli government spokesman David Mencer said Tuesday that the country's return to fighting in Gaza had been "fully coordinated with Washington" following the deadliest strikes on the territory since a fragile ceasefire took effect in January.

title: S Jaishankar Highlights UN's Blunder On Kashmir, Calls For New World Order
content: The injustice done by the West at the UN over Kashmir was highlighted at The Raisina Dialogue - a global multilateral conference held in New Delhi each year.

title: Sunita Williams, Butch Wilmore Head Back To Earth After 9 Months On ISS
content: Astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore are now closer home. They departed this morning from the International Space Station on the Dragon spacecraft after being "stranded" for nine months on the orbital hub.

title: Live Updates: Sunita Williams Heads Back To Earth After Nine Months
content: Astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore, who were stuck at the International Space Station (ISS) for more than nine months, began their return journey on Tuesday morning.

title: Trade Marks Registry Accepts 'Chutiyaram' For Biscuits Company, Does U-Turn
content: Two weeks after it accepted an application for the registration of the word 'Chutiyaram', making many wonder whether it was in keeping with a section barring trademarks that are considered obscene, the Trade Marks Registry has done a U-turn.

title: Fake Blood, Sharp Weapon: Reel Shoot Sparks Panic In Karnataka, 2 Arrested
content: An attempt to film a murder scene for an Instagram reel triggered panic in Karnataka's Kalaburagi late on Monday, police on Tuesday said, adding that two people have been arrested.

title: BCCI's Fresh Twist After Kohli's 'Family Diktat' Outburst - Report Explains
content: The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) may consider making changes to the 'family diktat' introduced after the Test series defeat against Australia, according to a report.

title: Samosas And The Risk Of Private Spacecraft: What Sunita Williams Had Told NDTV
content: Eight years before the Boeing Starliner suffered glitches, leaving her stranded on the International Space Station for nine months, NDTV had spoken to Sunita Williams and asked whether she thought flying on a privately built spacecraft could be risky

title: Pak Star Loses Cool After NZ Defeat: "People Are Waiting To See Us Lose..."
content: Pakistan cricket team fast bowler Haris Rauf lost his cool during the post-match press conference following his team's defeat against New Zealand in the second T20I encounter.

title: Missing Sudiksha Konanki's Parents Ask Cops To Declare Her Dead: Reports
content: Sudiksha Konanki, a citizen of India and a permanent resident of the United States, was last seen on March 6 at the Riu Republic Resort in Punta Cana town.

title: What Sunita Williams Will Experience During Spacecraft Reentry To Earth
content: From the astronaut's perspective, the view from a window during reentry is nothing but a wall of fire.

title: Sunita Williams headed back: Why 8-day mission turned into 9 months in space
content: butch Wilmore and sunita Williams are finally on their way back to earth via spaceX . the vessel detached during the early hours, targeting a water landing near the Florida coastline by early evening . it was initially planned as an eight-day mission, which was set for a nine-month stay .

title: College baseball Week 5: Top 25 rankings, play of the week and what to watch
content: will Hodo beat the Crimson Tide 6-2 in the ninth inning . the Volunteers have earned their first no. 1 ranking of the season . they have a great opportunity to reclaim that top spot if they can beat now top-10 ranked Texas this weekend .

title: Jadavpur University: One student arrested in connection with March 1 violence
content: Bengal Governor C.V. Ananda Bose says Jadavpur University VC should take a call on having a campus police outpost

title: Cape Town explores tech, tourism ties with Karnataka
content: Alderman James Vos met Priyank Kharge, Minister of IT&; BT, to discuss collaboration in technology, business process outsourcing (BPO), and tourism

title: Siddaramaiah challenges BJP to urge Centre to bring law on the lines of SCSP-TSP Act
content: During two-hour reply marked by heated exchanges between the Opposition and Treasury benches, Siddaramaiah listed out steps taken by his government for SC/ST welfare

title: BJP warns of Pakistan situation’s spillover into Jammu, asks security forces to stay alert
content: The BJP said that PM Modi’s initiates towards a peace process with Pakistan were responded by Pakistan launching a proxy war

title: Influence of Ramayana has spread beyond Indian subcontinent, says Union Minister
content: Gajendra Singh Shekhawat inaugurates a State-wide initiative to promote Kamba Ramayana - one of the most significant works in Tamil literature — by the South Zone Cultural Centre (SZCC).

title: Ramesh Chennithala seeks to be impleaded in PIL for rules to eradicate ragging from educational institutions
content: MLA says political patronage extended to students is a major factor contributing to the rise in ragging incidents and drug use

title: Youth told to take part in nation building by upholding Constitutional values
content: ‘Caste, crime and corruption are the cancers facing the country and they can be uprooted only when the youth come forward to fight them’

title: ECI sets the ball rolling on linking voter ID card with Aadhaar
content: Congress says EC must consult all political parties/stakeholders and assure them that “there are sufficient guardrails to not deny a single eligible voter the right to vote”

title: Bomb threat sparks panic at Thiruvananthapuram Collectorate, leading to unlikely bee attack
content: City Police act swiftly after receiving an email around 2 p.m. claiming that RDX had been planted in pipes within the Collectorate

title: Operation D-Hunt sees 365 cases and 387 arrests in three weeks in Thrissur
content: Among 365 cases, three involved commercial quantities, eight were medium quantity cases, and 29 cases involved small quantities

title: Only one woman cadet from Karnataka undergoing training in NDA
content: The first batch of women cadets joined NDA in August, 2022, and so far 126 cadets have joined the joint defence service training academy of the Indian armed forces

title: HC quashes POCSO case against headteacher
content: The headteacher was booked under the POCSO Act for not informing the police about the commission of the offence

title: Accusing CM of failing to keep his word, ASHAs seek ₹10,000 honorarium
content: Accredited Social Health Activists stage a huge demonstration in front of the Deputy Commissioner’s office in Haveri

title: AISF opposes closure of IIT Medical Academy in B.R. Ambedkar campus
content: The students demand that they be allowed to continue in the same campus at least for this academic year

title: Relatives demand probe into death of Thrissur student in Scotland
content: Body of Ebel Tharayil was found on railway tracks in Scotland on March 12. Family says there is no reason for Ebel to end his life

title: ₹1,186.84 crore due from Union government for school education, says Kerala Minister
content: The Centre had withheld the State’s due share for not signing the PM SHRI agreement, says General Education V. Sivankutty

title: Nearly 50% of assets under encroachment in Andhra Pradesh, says Waqf Board Chairman Abdul Azeez
content: Around 30,000 acres of land that is free from encroachment will be leased out through public auction, and the funds accrued thus will be used for the uplift of the community, he says

title: Meenachil river project will not adversely impact supply from Muvattupuzha: Roshy Augustine
content: Project aims to connect the Muvattupuzha and Meenachil basins and ensure a stable water supply for Kottayam

title: Centenary of Mahatma Gandhi’s first visit to Thrissur observed
content: Call to shape our thoughts, words, and actions in accordance with Gandhi’s principles so as to overcome the severe crises the world faces today

title: Over 50 MNCs to attend ‘Sankalp’ mega job mela in Ongole on March 19
content: JOb mela jointl organised by APSSDC and SEEDAP; selected candidates to get salaries ranging from ₹12,000 to ₹35,000, says District Skill Development Officer

title: Poovar shipyard project not on State’s priority list
content: Cost of constructing a breakwater at Poovar is high considering the peculiarity of the terrain, where the Neyyar river drains into the Arabian Sea, causing a large amount of siltation. This will increase the cost of annual dredging in the proposed site, says Minister

title: Judge imposes ₹1 crore costs on petitioner for ‘abusing legal process’ by suppressing facts
content: The conduct of the petitioner not only undermines the integrity of the judicial process but also leads to an abuse of legal remedies, causing unnecessary burden on the courts, says Justice Nagesh Bheemapaka

title: Efforts under way to attract top private and foreign universities to Andhra Pradesh, says IT Minister Lokesh
content: Emphasising the government’s commitment to expanding world-class educational opportunities, Lokesh tells the Legislative Assembly that the Cabinet has approved the establishment of BITS in Amaravati, allocating 70 acres to the prestigious institution; similarly, steps are afoot to set up a Deep Tech University in Amaravati and a dedicated AI University in Visakhapatnam, he says

title: Workers at Elstone Estate to launch protest on Saturday
content: Demand to settle their dues and ensure job security before taking over the estate for township project for landslides survivors

title: Concern over impact of high UV ray exposure on health as index goes up to  12 in Kerala
content: According to the Kerala State Disaster Management Authority, Munnar in Idukki recorded a UVI of 12 and Konni in Pathanamthitta 11 on March 17

title: Rajnath meets Dutch counterpart Berkelmans, says look forward to deepen defence partnership
content: Defence Ministers of India and Netherlands discuss deepening bilateral defence partnership, focusing on Indo-Pacific and emerging technologies

title: TTD member calls dharna attempt by seers and saints at Tirumala ‘unfortunate’
content: There is a provision to express protest up to Alipiri, the foot of Tirumala hills. But there are strictly laid down rules against staging any form of protest, demonstration or political activity beyond that. The respected saints should remember this, says Bhanuprakash Reddy

title: Assembly passes SC sub-categorisation Bill with all parties’ support
content: Some members urge government to implement 18% quota for SCs in nominated posts, small contracts, and in budget allocations

title: Winners and losers: UCLA’s rise, Notre Dame’s fall and South Carolina’s motivation
content: the Bruins have reached the 30-win mark for the first time in program history . they are hoping to make their first final four in the NCAA era . the top seeds are split between the Big Ten and the SEC .

title: Why betting the NCAA tournament is completely different from filling out your bracket
content: more people than ever are placing bets in addition to filling out their brackets . the major difference is that when you place a sports bet, you're picking teams, not teams . to win, your bracket needs to outperform a competition .

title: Dickie V makes his March Madness picks for every game
content: the big dance is here, and I'm ready to break it down, Dickie V style! we've got PTPers (prime time performers), diaper dandies and championship-caliber coaching ready to take the court .

title: Vice President to hold consultations to decide on Opposition demand for debate on EPIC
content: In an orderly House, the Opposition managed to get a word in on the EPIC duplication issue when TMC MP Saket Gokhale spoke during the Zero Hour on the demand for conferring the Bharat Ratna posthumously on the late T. N. Seshan, former Chief Election Commissioner

title: MoEFCC nod for permanent buildings of A.P. State Forest Academy in Diwancheruvu Reserve Forest
content: The Centre has given permission for diversion of a six-acre patch of land for the construction of permanent buildings for the APSFA, which was being run on regional forest research center campus  since the bifurcation of the State

title: MP Vemireddy moots IKSEZ project with IFFCO Chairman
content: Sanghani assured to look into the issue and make a positive decision, says the Nellore MP who believes that the district will get a thrust on the industrial front with the project

title: Kerala govt. plans new academic channel under KITE Victers
content: Steps to launch new channel will be taken after examining legal and technical aspects, says Minister

title: Govt.’s proposal to set up a CETP in Karur remains a non-starter
content: The rising overhead cost was said to be the main reason for shutting down eight common effluent treatment plants in Karur district; dyeing and bleaching units now depend on their own zero liquid discharge (ZLD) plants

title: Tripura court sentences three Rohingyas two years on the charge of infiltration
content: The judge stated that if the convicts fail to pay the fine, they will serve an additional month in jail

title: Kerala’s first cocoa farmer producer company to begin in Manimala
content: The venture, Brown Gold Cocoa Producer Company, will lease land both within and outside the State to expand cocoa cultivation. Farmers will receive subsidies, technical assistance, and guidance in growing and processing cocoa beans, says chairperson of the company

title: Thrust on garbage-free, drug-free Kottayam in district panchayat Budget
content: Kottayam district panchayat’s annual Budget focuses on drug-free initiatives, cancer prevention, beautification of public places, along with a host of community development projects. It envisages a total revenue of ₹144.77 crore and an expenditure of ₹142.87 crore with a surplus of ₹1.90 crore.

title: Special office to be set up to issue title deeds at Punalur
content: Steps are under way to provide title deeds to all eligible, build houses for everyone from the landless list, and to identify, acquire, and allocate revenue land

title: Political songs have no place in temple festivals, religious events, says Kerala HC
content: Directs the Travancore Devaswom Board (TDB) to file an affidavit within a week on the actions that have been taken against the advisory committee of the Kadakkal Devi temple in Kollam for organising a musical programme during the annual festival, where political songs were performed and political party flags were displayed on the stage.

title: More WhatsApp-based public services by June, says Andhra Pradesh IT Minister Lokesh
content: ‘Mana Mitra’ will offer 500 services, up from existing 200, Lokesh informs the Legislative Assembly; the government also plans to introduce AI-enabled voice services in one hundred days

title: Sathya Sai district police bust kidnapper gang from Karnataka targeting astrologer
content: Seven-member gang, believing that Manohar had the powers to trace hidden treasures, sought his help, kidnapped him and his aides when he refused to help; police arrest the gang on Kodikonda-Shira Highway at Madakasira, recover three firearms, seven bullets, two vehicles, a knife, seven mobile phones and ₹1.50 lakh cash

title: Electrical contractors launch indefinite strike
content: e-Paper The Hindu On Books Books of the week, reviews, excerpts, new titles and features . health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective .

title: Let the fun begin: Make your picks for the women's tournament
content: Welcome back to the #1 Women's Bracket game! The tourney tips off Friday, 3/21 @ 11:30a ET - don't get locked out, create your brackets today! Be sure to create a group and invite your friends to share in the madness.

title: It's bracket time: Make your picks for the men's tournament
content: Welcome back to the #1 men's bracket game! The tourney tips off Thursday, 3/20 @ 12:15p ET - don't get locked out, create your brackets today! Don't forget to create a group and invite your friends to share in the madness.

title: Opinion: Universities Are Feeling The Pinch As Indian Students Ditch The 'Big Four'
content: '1001 Nights' was a restaurant in St. Petersburg, Russia . four students from southern india worked part-time at the restaurant . their answer was simple: medical education in Russia was far more affordable . the hospital training was solid and their degrees were recognised back in India .
